posts.body:
Saw similar numbers until yesterday, then thanks to zenanon http://127.0.0.1:43110/Talk.ZeroNetwork.bit/?Topic:1582876093_14kTJXu4KZSoWSSNcGtXEijf4NqEGimc9J/08chan+limit I set
 "Help distribute added optional files" in 08chan right menu  and viola now I see 700/total, 530 onion, 600 connectable. 

Globally in zeronet stats I see 6500 peers so every tenth peer in  ecosystem shares 08chan now. 

Ten hours ago it was (I guess weekend peak) 1300 total peers and 900 onion in 08chan stats.. 

For torrent trackers I use Synchronite http://127.0.0.1:43110/15CEFKBRHFfAP9rmL6hhLmHoXrrgmw4B5o/

Current numbers 1040 total / 700 onion / 900 connectable.

What you can try:

1. turn off all zites which you seed
2. turn off 08chan too, restart zeronet (and tor if you use linux)
3. fire up zeronet (with tor of course) let it search for trackers/seeders for at least 3 min (green trackers numbers), turn on zerotalk or some small site (only one) to check you have peers to connect. 
4. turn on 08chan and let it synchronize

If nothing happens:

Use update and download previous files buttons. Rebuild and then reload 08chan database.

Finally you can try move your currently 08chan folder
 1DdPHedr5Tz55EtQWxqvsbEXPdc4uCVi9D
and start with clean 08chan from scratch to test it. 

Do you see at least half from Synchronite trackers? At least 20? Is number green? Do you use python3 zeronet version already?
Numbers are good. Till friday I was like OP - fuck it's dead. In fact IT IS NOT.

>>c3e95850-570a-4825-be39-60e2c3647b7c
ZeroNet is lambo but Zeronet + tor is   bicycle without wheels. I see crazy large 900 MB files and distribute it with tor through 6 pc (between two random users) with 10 min circuits reset (tor default connections life cycle) is beyond sane mind. 

Let' s face it with tor you can't distributed big files, it's not made for p2p service, you have to use VPN. Question is if you trust VPN services. 

With small files zeronet + tor works. 

Solution can be dividing big files to small parts (with 7zip, rar, on total commander) so users download all parts and merge them on their pc. 

"Had one zite which was deleting files (trying) for weeks. Almost nothing else would get processed, and I see this as a "bug" within the ZeroNet model. It's almost like a DDOS attack."

The zite had big files, right? Bigger than 10 - 15 MB.
It works for now. But first sticked post:

>>a384f590-fc97-4874-9d51-8a93504e8864
You can let linux in laptop and install chromeos in virtualbox or kvm do your job and wipe it out.  Have no experience with chrome but that fucker could write some nasty stuff to UEFI or else.

After some tweaking in zeronet.conf, these options are very helpful:

connected_limit (default: 8)  decrease it
global_connected_limit (default: 512) decrease it a lot
workers (default: 5) decrease it

Reduce them drastically. 

Tor after some time stole trackers connections  so no trackers = no peers = no connection to zites = no updates =  fubar. 

With cut down numbers I have at least 10 trackers constantly and rig is more stable.
